title: What champion do you feel is best designed?
body:
In terms of gameplay/ carries out their archetype best. 
Not in terms of balance.


As annoying as he may be to face, I would say {{champion:24}} 

His kit is very smooth, and he really carries out the feel of a melee master with any weapon.

replies.body:
I might be a bit biased on this one, but I think Hecarim is one of our better designed characters in terms of matching their archetype.

His high mobility and ability to crash into enemies lines (both via E and R) really makes me feel like terrifying undead cavalry. Also running down their ADC as they flee across the map is alarmingly satisfying...

A few other well done archetypes off the top of my head (as personal opinion without justification :P):

* Nautilus
* Yasuo
* Jinx

Another blue ribbon for {{champion:120}} !

So much mobility and ability to crash into enemies lines in fact, it took three nerfings in a row to get it all in line!

I think a large amount of players would disagree on the Yasuo one. I'm not sure how having two absurd passives that have nothing to do with one another on his main passive is good game design, nor is the 'infinite' infinite dashes or wind wall having no limit on what it can block.

I´m with ya on the Yasuo. Wind makes you just feel mobility, and Yasuo has mobility in absurd quantities. Also, his attacks are so fluid and smooth. Plus, tornadoes, walls of wind, and ninja jumps to ¨air¨borne targets!

I find Hecarim a bit gimmicky. His passive is pure gimmick and his W doesn't really do anything to enhance his theme, it's just random AoE damage with healing. And unless you're coming in from behind his E can be annoying trying to walk around an enemy to get the knockback done right.

I've got to give it to {{champion:45}} on two points:

1) Nobody fulfills the 'burst mage' archetype like the champ who can 100-0 a tank, late-game. Who's entire point is to turn the fight into a 4v5.

2) I think his identity fits in really well with his playstyle. In lane, since he wants to farm q, Veigar has no real lane presence. But he wants you to "know that if the tables were turned, [he] would show you no mercy!" And then you get to lategame and pop someone, and know that the tables have been turned.

I personally believe that {{champion:201}}  fits best into his archtype (self sacrificing support/super tank). He jumps INFRONT of allies and takes the damage for them. This perfectly fits into braums lore and his "attitude" (i.e. his quotes) in game.

i wouldnt consider malphite's ultimate a great interrupt by any means. kassadin's q is a great interrupt becuase its a lot cooldown and that is one of its main functions. malphite's ult is an initiation
It can still be served as great interrupt. It's for initiation, sure but that doesn't mean it has to be used ONLY for initiation.

Not entirely sure if you're trolling here by saying Quinn's the best adc and Skarner the best jungler, given the community's opinion of them recently. I personally love Quinn to pieces, but if you've read how slapdash her production was, there was lots of no communication and she was sorta rushed. But as you said, her theme works.

The best IMO:

{{champion:222}} - I just love the way she feels/plays out.  She's not my favorite overall, but I think Riot captured her feeling right.

{{champion:254}} - I think she was pretty well executed as a punching machine.

{{champion:69}} - She pretty much nails the concept of a poisonous snake-medusa lady.  

So those are the best ones.  

.

.

.

To me the worst are:

{{champion:28}} - I can't tell if she's supposed to be a melee auto attacker or a Q spammer.  Her last nerf left a lot of Eve players wondering what she is.  So if you can't id her archetype she's got to be bad.

{{champion:103}} - I love Ahri's concept but I'm not sure what she is anymore.  She's not mobile without her Ult, and even when she has it, it is limited.  She's not really a mage now, but she's not an assassin either.  So this is a case I can tell what she is supposed to be, but I can tell she's whiffing on all accounts aside from her visuals.

Rammus!

Oh my lord this champion is so well done. You take one look at his splash art and think - roving armored tank machine. Then you pick him up and what is he? A powerballing team-tanking gank monster. Every part of his kit feeds this fantasy - his powerball is perfect for the "armordillo" concept.

i love the synergy between taunt, ult, and def ball curl. Again, with the armordillo concept it makes total sense that Rammus' primary way of fighting is to just ball up and let the enemy just get destroyed while they waste their time trying to break his shell. Even his passive is perfect- as a player you understand that this is a character designed to stack armor, and pretty much nothing else.
That being said, I think we're long overdue for another yordle champion. Upboat if you agree.

OP you're gonna have to clarify whether you mean who delivers on their archetype/fantasy the best or who's gameplay design is the best.

I thought you meant fantasy, but many people who responded seem to have gone the gameplay route. 

In terms of delivering on a fantasy, my vote goes to Yasuo, Jinx, or Nautilus.

In terms of gameplay design, I think characters with clear strengths and weaknesses, like Kog'Maw and Braum are the healthiest.

I think they should be define by role, not position.

Tank: {{champion:54}} Malphite. His passive fits his tankiness, his slows and aa enhancers really make him a great champ for peeling or engaging. 

Assassin: {{champion:91}} Talon. He loves to pick off fleeing week targets with his passive. Its such a burst combo that makes his ability to kill great, but if they dont die, hes screwed.

Team Mage: {{champion:61}}  Orianna. A great aoe concept mage. I love it how shes so team orientated. She has the perfect ability to disrupt and do damage.

Burst Mage: {{champion:45}} Veigar. Hes such a great show of how to burst out one target really fast. His E doesnt fit as much since its an aoe stun, but it synergies with his W so well, i decided to but i anyway.

ADC: {{champion:67}}  Shes such a perfect late game carry, she just synergies so well with late game items

Engage Support: {{champion:89}} Leona. She has great tool or lockdown and engage, while her numbers need tweaking, her ideas are the best

Sustain Support: {{champion:37}}  Sona. No answer needed.

Peel Support: {{champion:143}} Zyra. Her kit has great means to deal damage while creating great opportunities for her adc

Assassin Jungle: {{champion:107}}  Rengar. He has a great combination of damage, cc and sustain. His ult wraps it up to make him the perfect idea of an assassin.

Tank Jungle: {{champion:77}} Perfect ability to clear, sustain, and take a ton of damage. While in it he does small aoe and cc. He is the best ambush tank.

Cassiopeia is probably the best designed champion in the game imo. Her kit is just pure synergy (Q, W designed to apply poison for the E reset DPS) and her abilities are very strongly linked to the medusa snake lady thematics she has going.

Orianna (all her abilities come form the ball, not from her), Syndra (playing with her spheres is epic fun) and Nautilus (really gives the feel of the clunky titan even though everyone builds to remove the intended low AS/MS weaknesses) are also up there as the best designed holistically.

Honorable mention to Maokai, Jinx and Vi.

No one's perfect but these guys come the closest to me.
For champions that match a theme I would have to say Gangplank. He makes you feel like a pirate.

Ah okay, thanks or clarification because a general 'best' is really hard to define.
---

Hmmmm, it's a tough choice, but I'd say Shyvana.

Her defining character trait (imho) is her anger at the world around her, and the rampaging that ensues because of it. Her Q gives her a great front-loaded momentum feel (more hits more Q's) and her W is perfect for the chasing and in-discriminatory destruction I feel like she would do. Not to mention her ult is just glorious in terms of going berserk. I'd even go as far to say she goes berserk better than Trynd or Olaf.
